Key Arguments: The bill threatens freedom of speech.
The government would define what constitutes misinformation and disinformation, which could lead to biased enforcement.
The government and mainstream media would be exempt from the rules, creating a double standard.
The definition of 'harm' is subjective and could be misused by bureaucrats.
The bill could lead to censorship by tech companies under government direction.
It could enforce ideological conformity and suppress dissenting views.
Notable Quotes: This bill would see the government define what truth is and give power to the Australian Communications and Media Authority (ACMA) and online platforms (META, YouTube) to enforce it.
The government would be the ultimate authority of truth and ideological conformity would be enforced in Australia.
